methods.name: sendUpdate
methods.description: sendUpdate - Pass the credit card type along with the values

methods.name: _determineCardType
methods.description: _determineCardType - Use current unmasked value to determine which kind of card the user is typing

accessors.name: _cardType
accessors.description: _cardType - Use current unmasked value to determine which kind of card the user is typing

accessors.name: mask
accessors.description: Dynamically determine which mask to use based on what kind of credit card numbers the user is typing

arguments.name: separator
arguments.description: What kind of separator to use between number sections

component:ember-inputmask/components/one.title: OneWayInputMask
component:ember-inputmask/components/one.text: Displays an input with the specified mask applied to it using Inputmask library. Follows Data-down actions up pattern

attributes.name: OneWayInputMask
attributes.description: Displays an input with the specified mask applied to it using Inputmask library. Follows Data-down actions up pattern

fields.name: attributeBindings
fields.description: Set the _value to be whatever the element.value is

methods.name: _changeEventListener
methods.description: _changeEventListener - A place to store the event listener we setup to listen to the 'input' events, because the Inputmask library events don't play nice with the Ember components event

methods.name: keyUp
methods.description: keyUp - If the keycode matches one of the keycodes in the keyEvents hash we want to fire the passed in action that matches it

methods.name: sendUpdate
methods.description: sendUpdate - Send the update action with the values. Components that inherit from this may need to override this if they want to pass additional data on the update

methods.name: _syncValue
methods.description: _syncValue - If this component's consumer modifies the passed in value inside their update method we want to make sure that value is reflected in the input's display.

methods.name: _processNewValue
methods.description: _processNewValue - Handle when a new value changes

params.name: value
params.description: - The masked value visible in the element

methods.name: _setupMask
methods.description: _setupMask - Connect the 3rd party input masking library to the element

methods.name: _getUnmaskedValue
methods.description: _getUnmaskedValue - Get the value of the element without the mask

methods.name: _changeMask
methods.description: _changeMask - Destroy and reapply the mask when the mask or options change so the mask and options can be dynamic

accessors.name: _value
accessors.description: Setup _value to be a positional param or the passed param if that is not defined

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to show inside the input. Can be first positionalParam

arguments.name: update
arguments.description: This action will be called when the value changes and will be passed the unmasked value and the masked value

arguments.name: decimal
arguments.description: Set this to true to include decimals

arguments.name: extensions
arguments.description: Whether or not to include extension in the mask

arguments.name: fullCode
arguments.description: Allows users to optionally enter the full ZIP+4 area code.

template:docs/index.title: Introduction
template:docs/index.text: Introduction Ember Inputmask is an Ember addon and a wrapper of the Inputmask.js library. It provides a general use input masking component, along with a set of commonly used masks

template:docs/one-way-credit-card-mask.title: One Way Credit Card Mask
template:docs/one-way-credit-card-mask.text: One Way Credit Card Mask Use this mask for formatting credit card numbers as the user types In addition to passing back the unmaskedValue and maskedValue, this input also automatically detects the cardType and returns it as a 3rd parameter Supported card types include: Visa MasterCard Discover JCB American Express Diners Club Separator You can change the default separator if you don't like -

template:docs/one-way-currency-mask.title: One Way Currency Mask
template:docs/one-way-currency-mask.text: One Way Currency Mask Use this mask for formatting money amounts as the user types Options You can specify other options from the Inputmask.js Number Extension in the options hash Placeholder The default currency mask from Inputmask.js always shows the currency mask as a placeholder and doesn't let you show a custom placeholder. If you want your own placeholder text instead of $0.00 you can set clearMaskOnLostFocus=true in the options hash.

template:docs/one-way-date-mask.title: One Way Date Mask
template:docs/one-way-date-mask.text: One Way Date Mask Use this mask for formatting dates and times as the user types Input Format You can change the inputFormat via the options hash from Inputmask.js Output Format You can change the outputFormat via the options hash from Inputmask.js Make sure the value you pass in matches the inputFormat that is expected. This may mean that you pass in the masked value instead of the unmasked value Time You can use time options as well

template:docs/one-way-email-mask.title: One Way Email Mask
template:docs/one-way-email-mask.text: One Way Email Mask Use this mask for formatting email addresses as the user types

template:docs/one-way-input-mask.title: One Way Input Mask
template:docs/one-way-input-mask.text: One Way Input Mask This is foundational component that all the other components extend from. Basic Mask Supply a mask attribute following the instructions in Inputmask.js Options You can pass any of the options mentioned in Inputmask.js through an options hash Actions Some of the options are actions. Use the action helper to pass in a closure action. Updating Values Pass one-way-input-mask an update action and it will return the unmaskedValue and the masked value. Passing in Values You can pass one-way-input-mask a value as the first position param. The component expects you to pass in an unmasked value

template:docs/one-way-number-mask.title: One Way Number Mask
template:docs/one-way-number-mask.text: One Way Number Mask Use this mask for formatting numbers as the user types Integers The default behavior is to format integers Decimals You can format decimals by passing in the decimal option. You must pass a value and an update method in order for this to work Number of Decimals Pass in the number of digits in the options hash to change how many decimals are shown Options You can specify other options from the Inputmask.js Number Extension in the options hash

template:docs/one-way-phone-mask.title: One Way Phone Mask
template:docs/one-way-phone-mask.text: One Way Phone Mask Use this mask for formatting phone numbers as the user types Extensions You can included extensions in the mask by passing extensions=true

template:docs/one-way-ssn-mask.title: One Way SSN Mask
template:docs/one-way-ssn-mask.text: One Way SSN Mask Use this mask for formatting social security numbers as the user types

template:docs/one-way-zip-code-mask.title: One Way Zip Code Mask
template:docs/one-way-zip-code-mask.text: One Way Zip Code Mask Use this mask for formatting zip codes as the user types Full Code Pass fullCode=true to do a full zip code

template:not-found.title: Not found
template:not-found.text: Not found This page doesn't exist. Head home?
